descript.abstract: City of Cambridge, MA, GIS basemap development project encompasses the land area of City of Cambridge with a 200-foot fringe surrounding the area and Charles River shoreline towards Boston. The basemap data was developed at 1" = 40' mapping scale using digital photogrammetric techniques. Planimetric features; both man-made and natural features like vegetation, rivers have been depicted. These features are important to all GIS/mapping applications and publication. A set of data layers such as Buildings, Roads, Rivers, Utility structures, 1 ft interval contours are developed and represented in the geodatabase. The features are labeled and coded in order to represent specific feature class for thematic representation and topology between the features is maintained for an accurate representation at the 1:40 mapping scale for both publication and analysis. The basemap data has been developed using procedures designed to produce data to the National Standard for Spatial Data Accuracy (NSSDA) and is intended for use at 1" = 40 ' mapping scale. Where applicable, the vertical datum is NAVD1988.
descript.purpose: City of Cambridge 1" - 40' base map layers from an April 12 & April 22, 2018 flyover. Basemap layers created by WSP.
descript.supplinf: Aerial Triangulation was completed using Hexgaon Geospatial ISAT v16.5. Data stereo compilation was completed using KLT Associates DSP v1.15.004. Data conversion and GIS layer preparation was done using ESRI ArcGIS for Desktop v10.6.

dataqual.logic: The dataset contains vector (planimetric, Topography and Contours) files and raster (Ortho imagery) and LiDAR. The file naming convention of the datasets is based on a Basic Modular Unit of tile grid adopted by the City of Cambridge, MA based on the NAD_1983_StatePlane_Massachusetts_Mainland_FIPS_2001_Feet, and vertical datum is NAVD 1988. The neat area is bounded by the state plane grid whose easting and northing are evenly divisible by 2640 x 2640 feet. Each Basic Modular Unit map is identified by a map number derived from grid naming convention with alphanumeric values. The rows are numbered from South to North and the Columns named with A, B, C, from West to East. E.g. A1, A2, etc.
dataqual.complete: Any data outside of the Cambridge City boundary may not be updated

horizpa.horizpar: Compiled to meet horizontal and vertical accuracy at 95% confidence level in accordance with ASPRS Class 1 standards.

vertacc.vertaccr: Compiled to meet the vertical accuracy at 95% confidence level in accordance with ASPRS Class 1 standards.

procstep.procdesc: Aerial Image Acquisition: On 4/12 and 4/22 2018, Keystone Aerial Surveys collected 9 flight lines of photos totaling 478 exposures using an UltraCam Falcon Prime frame digital sensor at an average altitude of 3900' above sea level. The photo mission was flown with 80% forward overlap and 60% sidelap to reduce building lean to facilitate feature compilation. The image dataset was delivered to WSP who performed aerial triangulation using existing ground control and stereo compilation using Hexagon ISAT and KLT DSP software packages. The final GIS dataset was delivered to the City of Cambridge as a City-wide seamless ESRI File Geodatabase which meets ASPRS Class 1 accuracy standards.

cntaddr.address: Northeast Philadelphia Airport - Grant Ave. and Ashton Road

procstep.procdesc: Aerial Triangulation: WSP triangulated the image dataset using Hexagon ISAT v16.5. Inputs included the raw aerial imagery, airborne GPS and ground control.

Data Compilation: WSP used the triangulated imagery to collect features as outlined in the geodatabase design provided by the City of Cambridge. Features were collected using digital stereo compilation in x, y and z coordinate space.

Data conversion: The stereo compiled data was converted from native CAD format to ESRI data layers using ESRI ArcGIS for desktop v10.6. Polygon features were constructed using associated line layers that bound the feature.

Data QC: All data layers were checked visually for completeness and compared with existing 2010 data. Topology checks were run to eliminate overlaps, duplicate features and features that did not meet expected tolerances.
Delivery: Data was delivered to the City of Cambridge in an ESRI File Geodatabase v10.6

mapproj.mapprojn: NAD 1983 StatePlane Massachusetts Mainland FIPS 2001 Feet

enttyp.enttypd: Building is a man made structure used or intended for supporting or sheltering any use or continuous occupancy. Visible outline of the building roof is collected as polygon feature.

Elevation of highest point above sea level (NAVD88)

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
